intro: Gagea olgae, commonly known as the Alpine gagea, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in early spring, producing white or pale purple flowers that are clustered at the base of the foliage. Gagea olgae thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, alpine climates. Its botanical features make it a notable species in high-altitude ecosystems.
